nuclei_findings.description: POST to /products with crafted category_id returned 500 and SQL error text
extracted_data: You have an error in your SQL syntax near "' OR '1'='1" at line 1

response_indicators: You have an error in your SQL syntax

evidence.response: HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error\n...You have an error in your SQL syntax near "' OR '1'='1" at line 1...
evidence.proof_of_concept: Submitting category_id=1' OR '1'='1 triggers SQL error (500) confirming injection point and ability to manipulate query. Further exploitation can enumerate columns via time-based or error-based techniques.

impact_assessment.data_exposure: Potential exposure of database contents, sensitive customer and order information
impact_assessment.system_impact: Data disclosure, data modification, potential privilege escalation depending on DB account permissions

exploitation_results.recommendations: Use parameterized queries/prepared statements or ORM binding; validate and sanitize input server-side; enforce least privilege for DB accounts; add WAF rules to detect SQLi payloads; add input length and type checks.

exploitation_results.vulnerability_title: Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in search parameter

nuclei_findings.description: Reflected script payload present in HTML response

response_indicators: Reflected script tag in HTML body

evidence.proof_of_concept: Reflected script appears unencoded in the response; an attacker can craft a link to execute JS in victims' browsers leading to session theft or CSRF actions.

impact_assessment.data_exposure: Potential theft of session cookies, DOM data, or execution of actions as user
impact_assessment.system_impact: Account takeover on victim browsers, credential theft, or delivery of further payloads

exploitation_results.recommendations: Apply context-aware output encoding (HTML-encode) user-supplied input, use secure templating/escaping libraries, implement Content Security Policy (CSP), and validate/sanitize inputs.

exploitation_results.vulnerability_title: Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) in order access

nuclei_findings.description: GET /orders/1024 returned order details for a different user (ownership mismatch)

response_indicators: 200 OK with JSON containing "userId":204 (different from authenticated user)

evidence.proof_of_concept: Authenticated user can enumerate order IDs and retrieve other users' orders. Access control check missing on resource fetch.

impact_assessment.data_exposure: Exposure of PII, order details, shipping addresses, payment metadata
impact_assessment.system_impact: Privacy violations, potential fraud or targeted attacks using harvested PII

exploitation_results.recommendations: Enforce server-side authorization checks for resource ownership on every access; implement indirect references; add automated authorization tests and audit logs.

nuclei_findings.description: Set-Cookie header for session cookie observed without Secure attribute

response_indicators: Set-Cookie header present without Secure attribute

evidence.proof_of_concept: Cookie lacks Secure flag; if the application or environment ever serves content over HTTP or is subject to mixed-content, the cookie could be transmitted unencrypted.

impact_assessment.data_exposure: Session cookie could be exposed over non-HTTPS channels in mixed scenarios
impact_assessment.system_impact: Increased risk of session hijacking; reduces transport-layer cookie protections

exploitation_results.recommendations: Set Secure attribute on session cookies, maintain HttpOnly, and consider SameSite=lax/strict. Ensure all traffic is HTTPS and redirect HTTP to HTTPS.

nuclei_findings.description: jQuery 1.9.1 string found in served JS file

evidence.proof_of_concept: The file served contains jQuery v1.9.1. Presence confirmed; exploitation requires a client-side attack chain (e.g., DOM XSS) using known jQuery issues, so direct server-side impact not demonstrated here.

impact_assessment.data_exposure: Indirect — may enable client-side attacks if combined with injectable vectors
impact_assessment.system_impact: Potential client-side compromise; increases attack surface

exploitation_results.recommendations: Upgrade jQuery to a secure supported version after compatibility testing; use Subresource Integrity (SRI); serve libraries from trusted/CDN sources and maintain a software bill of materials.

custom_templates.template_content:
id: acme-sqli-products
info:
  name: "ACME SQLi - products category_id"
  author: "pentester"
  severity: high
  description: "Detect SQL Injection via category_id parameter on /products using a boolean payload that triggers SQL error"
requests:
  - method: POST
    path:
      - "{{BaseURL}}/products"
    body: "category_id=1' OR '1'='1"
    headers:
      Content-Type: "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
    matchers:
      - type: status
        status:
          - 500
      - type: word
        part: body
        words:
          - "You have an error in your SQL syntax"
          - "SQL syntax"
custom_templates.creation_reasoning: The report shows an SQL error when category_id includes "' OR '1'='1". Created template to reproduce the exact payload, detect 500 responses and SQL error strings to confirm exploitable SQLi.

custom_templates.template_content:
id: acme-xss-search
info:
  name: "ACME Reflected XSS - search q param"
  author: "pentester"
  severity: medium
  description: "Detect reflected XSS in q parameter of /search by submitting script payload and checking reflection in response"
requests:
  - method: GET
    path:
      - "{{BaseURL}}/search?q=<script>alert(1)</script>"
    matchers:
      - type: word
        part: body
        words:
          - "<script>alert(1)</script>"
custom_templates.creation_reasoning: Report evidence showed script was reflected verbatim. Template uses same script payload to confirm reflection and execution risk.

custom_templates.template_content:
id: acme-idor-orders
info:
  name: "ACME IDOR - orders path"
  author: "pentester"
  severity: high
  description: "Detect IDOR on /orders/{orderId} by checking returned order owner differs from authenticated user (indicator strings from report)"
requests:
  - method: GET
    path:
      - "{{BaseURL}}/orders/1024"
    matchers:
      - type: status
        status:
          - 200
      - type: word
        part: body
        words:
          - "user id 204"
          - '"userId":204'
          - '"orderId":1024'
custom_templates.creation_reasoning: Report indicated GET /orders/1024 returned order details for user id 204. Template checks orderId and userId strings to confirm ownership mismatch and unauthorized access.

custom_templates.template_content:
id: acme-cookie-secure-missing
info:
  name: "ACME Cookie Secure Missing"
  author: "pentester"
  severity: low
  description: "Detect session cookie without Secure attribute in Set-Cookie header"
requests:
  - method: GET
    path:
      - "{{BaseURL}}/"
    matchers:
      - type: regex
        part: headers
        regex:
          - "Set-Cookie:\s*session=[^;]+;\s*HttpOnly;\s*Path=/"
custom_templates.creation_reasoning: Report showed Set-Cookie header missing Secure. Template inspects response headers for the session cookie with HttpOnly but without Secure to confirm.

custom_templates.template_content:
id: acme-outdated-jquery
info:
  name: "ACME Outdated jQuery 1.9.1"
  author: "pentester"
  severity: info
  description: "Detect inclusion of jQuery 1.9.1 in /static/js/jquery.min.js"
requests:
  - method: GET
    path:
      - "{{BaseURL}}/static/js/jquery.min.js"
    matchers:
      - type: word
        part: body
        words:
          - "1.9.1"
          - "jQuery v1.9.1"
custom_templates.creation_reasoning: Static analysis found jQuery 1.9.1 referenced. Template fetches the JS file and checks version strings to confirm presence of outdated library.

summary.additional_findings: Confirmed SQLi, reflected XSS, and IDOR on endpoints mapped to http://localhost:8080. Session cookie lacking Secure flag confirmed. Outdated jQuery 1.9.1 present (confirmed) — client-side exploitation requires a chain and was not demonstrated here. Recommend prioritized remediation: fix SQLi and broken access control immediately, patch XSS, enforce cookie Secure, and upgrade JS libraries. Ensure tests are re-run in production-equivalent environment and add monitoring/WAF rules to detect active exploitation attempts.
